blog.name: tyrusoldme-am-spoilers
blog.title: Theodore James is the ONLY correct answer

body:
I’m crying again

I was leaving for school this morning and on the kitchen counter was a salt shaker and a pepper shaker.


The pepper was standing upright but the salt was knocked over.

icon by @spidaerman

summary: Prompt: TJ is walking with Kira in the caf super bored because shes not letting him talk and is talking about all her wins. And...
question: Prompt: TJ is walking with Kira in the caf super bored because shes not letting him talk and is talking about all her wins. And then we see Cyrus with his friends all sad and he looks up and TJ sees him. And then tj is like I'm just gonna do a quick walk by and kira pulls him away. Idk if that makes sense but I thought it was a cute parallel.
answer:
ahhh my poor heart, these kids deserve the world!

it’s angsty because i live to suffer apparently lmao.

He doesn’t know how this happened.

Well he does, actually.  TJ knows exactly what transpired to get him here, listening to Kira talk about the half court shot she managed to sink once and how she broke someone’s ankles with her crossovers last season.  It was all him, being too insecure, too broken, too scared to tell Cyrus what was going on.  

He’s learned to block Kira’s words out.  They’ve been “hanging out” since costume day, Kira quick to get in with the basketball team and even quicker to claim TJ as her accomplice.  He supposes that he deserves this.  After all, he was the one who bailed on Cyrus without good reason on costume day.  If only he had called.  Why didn’t he just call?

It’s been a week approximately.  By that, he means it’s been six days, three hours, and four minutes since he’d shown up with half of a  “double dribble” costume and not flip flops and board shorts.  Cyrus hasn’t attempted to speak to him at all.  Not that TJ can blame him.  His finger has hovered over the call button on his phone at least a thousand times since then.  He never goes through with it.  All he can hear when he goes to explain himself are Kira’s words, cloaked in summer green air and passive anger.

“So you’d rather do a costume with Cyrus than with me?  Good luck with that.”

“So you’d rather do a costume with a boy instead of me?  Good luck with that.”

She’s never said the second part, he just assumes that’s what her words were meant to mean.  In fact, now that Kira’s got him cornered, all she talks about is foul shots and balling up.  He’s really only here to get her a spot on the boy’s team to achieve her ultimate goal of hurting Buffy.  TJ has to blindly wonder if hurting Cyrus was the plan or just a consequence.  

They’re walking around the cafeteria, Kira immersed in one of her stories from her old days of yore or whatever.  TJ’s nodding at what he hopes are the right parts when he sees him.  TJ stops in his tracks and blinks in almost disbelieving shock.  Cyrus is sitting with the GHC and Jonah, as usual, but instead of a bright cheery smile and a chocolate chocolate chip muffin by his side, he looks like someone’s spilled ink on his favorite penguin sweater.  

TJ feels the muscles in his heart clench.  He hasn’t actually seen Cyrus since costume day and for some reason, his brain had come to the conclusion that Cyrus had to have been okay.  He clearly wasn’t.  TJ’s debating whether to dump his yogurt drink on Kira’s head or grind it into her shirt when Cyrus looks up and his muscles are atrophied again.  Cyrus’ face contorts for a moment before arranging itself into something that’s supposed to look strong.  TJ’s heart aches and he wants so badly to tell Cyrus he’s sorry.  The words have been on his tongue since last Friday, strange combinations of gayoutedimsorrythreatenedsorrysorryforgiveme.  He clenches his fists.

“I’m going to do a walk by, make sure Cyrus is okay,” he looks at Kira with a pointed glare and folded arms, daring her to contradict him.  She smirks at him and places a solid hand on his shoulder, weighing him back down to the ground.

“Sure.  Good luck making that look casual.”  He looks at her smile for a minute, feeling the familiar weight of loss on his shoulders.  Kira already knows she’s won when she tucks an arm under his and pulls him away and back to the team.  TJ looks back frantically to where Cyrus sits.  His bravado has faded and his face drops as TJ gets further and further away.  TJ closes his eyes as Kira starts in on her skills again.

He wishes he could sink into the floor and never resurface.
answer_abstract:
ahhh my poor heart, these kids deserve the world!

it’s angsty because i live to suffer apparently lmao.

He’s learned to block Kira’s words out.  They’ve been “hanging out” since costume day, Kira quick to get in with the basketball team and even quicker to claim TJ as her accomplice.  He supposes that he deserves this.  After all, he was the one who bailed on Cyrus without good reason on costume day.  If only he had called.  Why didn’t he just call?

sadie. 23. she/they. lesbian. here to talk about tv & give advice. hoodie enthusiast. fandom mother.

main blog & twitter: sadieannerue instagram: dailymackcast, andimackpapercraneproject

summary: waittt age them up? I thought next year they were entering high school....? how old are they?
question: waittt age them up? I thought next year they were entering high school....? how old are they?
answer:
They are assumed to be in eighth grade currently, but that doesn’t guarantee that they would be in high school in the next season. They have ret-conned before (Jonah was in 8th grade in the first season, but is now in the same grade as the GHC). Also the season finale is set during winter which means that they could get away with having the 4th season of the show take place during their last semester of middle school instead of aging them up to high school. 

But if they were to renew, they would honestly need to age them up to high school for a lot of reasons. One being that Josh and Luke are both turning 18 this year and are having trouble passing as middle school students already (they would also get less shit for having a gay couple if they were seen as high school students, as opposed to being seen as children like they are now). Another being so the extended production/filming hiatus would make more sense, and so that they could give the series a fresh new look by switching schools.
